com.ibm.hrl.xmleditor.extension.importer
Interface XMLImporter

All Known Implementing Classes:
BMLImporter
public interface XMLImporter
extends Extension

This interface defines the methods a document importer should implement. An importer is a java component that extends Xeena to enable it to import any resource into an XML document. Any importer should implement the XMLImporter interface and a constructor with an empty argument list. Warning: this class may not be compatible with future releases.

See Also:
XMLExporter

Method Summary
 boolean importDocument(org.w3c.dom.Document _doc)
          Tells the importer to import a resource into a DOM Document.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.ibm.hrl.xmleditor.extension.Extension
getIcon, getName, getToolTip, init, setXMLEditorContext
 

Method Detail

importDocument

public boolean importDocument(org.w3c.dom.Document _doc)
Tells the importer to import a resource into a DOM Document. It should be done by filling the _doc which is an empty DOM Document with elements, attributes etc.
Parameters:
_doc - an empty DOM Document.
Returns:
true if import was successful.
